article.headline: Utah 92, Cal Poly 76
article.story: SAN LUIS OBISPO, Calif. (AP) -- Andrew Bogut tallied his eighth double-double in 11 games Wednesday as Utah beat Cal Poly 92-76. The 7-foot center was 9-for-16 from the floor and finished with 23 points and 12 rebounds for the Utes (8-3). Cal Poly (2-5) kept it close in the first half thanks to a good perimeter game that saw the Mustangs hit half of their 32 floor shots. Freshman Dawin Whiten scored his team's first 11 points and hit his first four 3-point attempts, notching 19 points by the half. He finished with a career-high 29 points, fouling out with 7:32 left. But Utah, which led 43-40 at halftime, pulled away early in the second half thanks to a 13-3 run capped by a breakaway dunk by Justin Hawkins. Utah outscored Cal Poly 49-63 in the second half and had four players reach double figures. Hawkins finished 19 points, while Richard Chaney added 21 and Marc Jackson 12.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
